metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21980 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Client programs). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.41 and prior and 8.0.32 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 7.1 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21980` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-router - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.33-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
